qas.question: When were the new plans of the airport revealed?
When are the new plans supposed to come to fruition for the airport?
How many runways will be in the new airport?
How many passengers will the new airport be able to handle?
How much does the new airport cost?

context: During his annual state-of-the-nation address on <a0_0>September 2, 2014<a0_0/>, President of Mexico Enrique Peña Nieto unveiled plans for a new international airport to ease the city's notorious air traffic congestion, tentatively slated for a <a1_0>2018<a1_0/> opening. The new airport, which would have <a2_0>six<a2_0/> runways, will cost <a4_0>$9.15 billion<a4_0/> and would be built on vacant federal land east of Mexico City International Airport. Goals are to eventually handle <a3_0>120 million<a3_0/> passengers a year, which would make it the busiest airport in the world.
